common_issues.title: PiecesOS slow boot-up and launch issues
common_issues.description: Users reported slow boot-up times and launch failures with PiecesOS, particularly after updates. The issue seems to affect both macOS and Windows. Suggested solutions include updating to the latest version, giving the app time to migrate data, and providing log files to support for diagnosis.

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary 

This issue is about PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up and being stuck on the first step. The problem was caused by an issue with the new 11.1.0 build.

## Key points raised

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and is stuck on the first step.
* This is a known issue with the new 11.1.0 build.
* The issue is caused by a major migration of data from the previous stack to the new stack.
* There is a workaround by giving PiecesOS a couple of minutes to migrate.

## Problems identified

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up.
* PiecesOS is stuck on the first step.
* The issue is caused by a major migration of data from the previous stack to the new stack.

## Solutions proposed/implemented

* Give PiecesOS a couple of minutes to migrate.
* Update to the latest 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS.
* Close and re-open the app.

## Current status/outcome

* The issue has been resolved with the release of 11.1.2.
* The workaround of giving PiecesOS a couple of minutes to migrate is still valid.
* The issue of the app being stuck on the first step on macOS is still being investigated.


## Other Information

* The original issue was reported on 2025-02-05.
* The issue was resolved on 2025-02-07.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to AVX2 incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS crashing on launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency on AVX2 instructions, which older CPUs lack. * Helpful resources: Existing Issues, Documentation, YouTube Channel

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Issues:**

* User was unable to link their Google and GitHub accounts due to an issue with the existing account linking flow. This resulted in two separate accounts being created for the user.
* The user needed one of the accounts to be designated as their primary account and the other account to be merged into it.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Meet with the user to manually resolve the issue by merging the two accounts.
* Have the user sign out and back in to trigger the account linking flow.
* Wait for the new authentication service to be implemented, which would address the account linking issues.

**Implemented Solutions:**

* The user provided their email addresses, allowing the support representative to identify the correct accounts.
* The support representative initially tried to have the user sign out and back in to trigger the account linking flow.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The initial attempt to resolve the issue by having the user sign out and back in was unsuccessful.
* The support representative identified a possible case sensitivity issue with the user's email addresses. 
* The user decided to wait for the new authentication service before attempting to relink the accounts.
* The new authentication service is expected to be ready for use at the end of February.

**Additional Information:**

* The user has a custom domain set up with their Google account, which will be kept as their primary account.
* The support representative reset the user's GitHub account to allow for another relink attempt.

**Next Steps:**

* The user will wait for the new authentication service to be implemented before attempting to relink their accounts.
* The user will be among the first to be staged for the new system once it's available.
* The support representative will reset the user's GitHub account again before the next relink attempt.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)

related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## GitHub Conversation Summary: Ollama Server Errors on Pieces OS

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk encountered Cuda errors related to Ollama server running on Pieces OS.
* The `cublas64_12.dll` error specifically occurred with Pieces OS's Ollama server instances.
* User reinstalled Ollama and Pieces OS separately and confirmed Ollama worked on its own.
* The system errors appeared during Pieces OS boot-up, despite Ollama being installed separately.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting installations of Ollama via Pieces OS and standalone installer.
* Startup order causing Pieces OS to attempt starting a separate Ollama instance.
* Underlying cause of the Cuda errors remained unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS separately.
* Manually verifying the `ollama` keyword path and file integrity.
* Disabling Pieces OS launch on sign-in as a workaround.
* User requested the ability for Pieces OS to detect external Ollama instances and adjust its behavior accordingly.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved for the user through multiple reinstalls and path cleanups, although the cause remained unclear.
* The user requested a feature for Pieces OS to detect external Ollama instances.
* The developer acknowledged the user's feedback and will investigate implementing the requested feature.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `GetReal444` reported an issue booting up PiecesOS.
* The issue appears related to AVX2 not being supported on the user's processor.
* The issue might be affecting more users than initially expected.
* Pieces team is actively working on a solution.

**Problems Identified:**

* User's processor does not support AVX2, which is required by a PiecesOS database service.
* This issue potentially affects other users with similar processors.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is working on a patch to address the AVX2 dependency issue.
* A new version (11.1.2) of PiecesOS was released with the patch.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved with the latest version of PiecesOS.
* User `GetReal444` confirmed that the issue is fixed.

**Additional Notes:**

* Pieces team provided helpful resources and offered assistance to the user.
* The issue was addressed quickly and efficiently.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS boot-up and launch issues:** This is the most frequent and impactful problem reported by users. Focus on identifying the root causes of slow boot-up times, launch failures, and "Ensuring Core Dependencies" errors, particularly in versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1.  Investigate data migration processes and potential conflicts with system configurations.

**Improve communication around AVX2 incompatibility:** Clearly communicate the minimum hardware requirements, including AVX2 support, on the PiecesOS download page and release notes. Provide clear instructions for users with older CPUs who encounter launch crashes.

**Investigate and resolve account linking issues:** Address the problem of users being unable to link both Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Review and improve the account linking flow to ensure a seamless user experience.

**Provide troubleshooting steps for cloud service and local LLM connectivity:** Create comprehensive documentation for resolving cloud service connection errors and issues with local LLM integration. This should include verifying internet connection, checking firewall settings, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and locally installed LLM instances.

**Consider implementing automatic detection of external Ollama instances:** Explore the feasibility of Pieces OS automatically detecting and utilizing externally installed Ollama servers to avoid conflicts and improve user experience.

**Proactively monitor for emerging issues:** Regularly analyze support tickets and community forums to identify and address emerging trends or recurring problems. This will help to stay ahead of potential support escalations and improve overall product quality.
